sentences: Kõik arstid said koolitust uute meetodite kohta.
Arstid on olulised inimeste tervise eest.
context: The word 'arstid' is the plural form of the Estonian noun 'arst', meaning 'doctor'. It refers to multiple doctors or physicians as a group. The suffix '-id' indicates plurality in Estonian, similar to how we add '-s' or '-es' in English to make nouns plural.
